Tomorrow, the Duncan community has the opportunity to vote on what we have called DPS 2020 Vision for the August 25th ballot. This 10-year student investment program for $27,775,000 is not projected to raise taxes. The ballot will contain two propositions: one for facilities/equipment and one for student transportation. Duncan Public Schools has been recognized as a statewide leader in strategic planning and implementation. If approved by voters, DPS 2020 Vision will help ensure that important work continues.

DPS 2020 Vision addresses four key areas: safety, students, community and stewardship. Please exercise your right to VOTE on Tuesday. https://www.duncanbanner.com/opinion/column-dreams-of-our-children----dps-2020-vision/article_59f02aa6-4a13-11ea-afda-ef1ab76be2b0.html

Have you done your part for the Duncan community by filling out the 2020 Census yet? Participation in the census is vital as it means federal dollars coming to Oklahoma at an estimated $1,700 per person per year for ten years for programs funded by population numbers. Our local response is slightly better than the state average but lower than the national average.

Census participation helps keep state taxes at a lower rate. By answering the census, you protect federal funding for programs such as SoonerCare, Title I schools, as well as for road and bridge construction and maintenance.

Filling out the 2020 Census is easy to do. You can go to https://my2020census.gov/ and respond online. If you prefer to visit with someone from the US Census via phone, you can call one of their customer service representatives. They are available every day from 7 a.m. to 2 a.m. Eastern Time on the following phone lines: English: 844-330-2020 Spanish: 844-468-2020.

Dear DPS Staff, Students, and Parents,

During Spring Break, Duncan Public Schools will continue to monitor the spread of the COVID 19 virus and the potential impact it might have on our students, staff, and schools. Healthcare and emergency management officials continue to provide direction to schools, but it is still impossible to predict how Duncan might be impacted.

We are cooperating fully with healthcare and emergency management authorities as this situation develops. Duncan Public Schools will provide updates as appropriate through our school messenger, website, and Facebook pages. Principals will push information through site avenues. We have also provided links to several resources at www.duncanps.org under the Coronavirus Information tab.

Please know that we will continue monitoring this closely and will do our best to keep you informed. May everyone have a safe and enjoyable spring break.

By grace,
Tom Deighan

We hope that you are aware by now that the Duncan Public Schools Board of Education recently kicked off DPS 2020 Vision for the April 7, 2020 ballot. The 10-year student investment program for $27,775,000 is not projected to raise taxes. The ballot will contain two propositions: one for facilities/equipment and one for student transportation. Duncan Public Schools has been recognized as a statewide leader in strategic planning and implementation. If approved by voters, DPS 2020 Vision will help ensure that important work continues.

DPS 2020 Vision addresses four key areas: safety, students, community and stewardship. The Board also worked tirelessly to ensure that every student, every program and every school benefit directly from any additional funding. By avoiding any projected tax increase, Duncan Public Schools district millage rates will remain about 50% less than % less than school bond millage rates (property tax) for neighboring districts.

We will be sharing additional details as we get closer to April 7 and we welcome your questions.
